section.title: Time phrases with the Present perfect and Past simple
section.sectiontitle: With the Present perfect, we do not say exactly when the action happened or we are not interested in when.
section.text1: We don't know when she saw King Kong.
section.text2: We are not interested in when they won.
section.sectiontitle2: With the Present perfect, we often use imprecise time words like just, recently, never or ever.

section.title: Time phrases with the Present perfect and Past simple
section.sectiontitle: With the Past simple, we often use exact past time phrases like in 2004,  last year, yesterday, at eight o'clock, ten minutes ago.
